citation.article-title: Demequina lutea sp. nov., isolated from a high Arctic permafrost soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Demequina lutea sp. nov.
Demequina lutea (lu′te.a. L. fem. adj. lutea yellow).
Cells stain Gram-positive and are non-motile, non-spore-forming rods (0.5–0.7×1.5 μm).
Colonies on R2A medium are circular, smooth and yellow-pigmented.
Grows optimally under aerobic conditions on R2A medium but also grows slowly under strictly anaerobic conditions.
Growth occurs at 4–30 °C with an optimum between 25 and 30 °C.
Extended incubation times are required for cultures grown at 4 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6–9, with an optimum at pH 7.
Cells grow optimally in the absence of salt but tolerate up to 2 % NaCl (w/v).
Cells are negative for oxidase activity and positive for catalase activity.
Nitrate reduction to nitrite is positive, H2S is not produced, arginine is not hydrolysed and indole production is negative.
Cells are weakly positive for β-galactosidase and alkaline phosphatase but negative for urease, gelatinase, amylase, cellulase and lipase.
Cells can also utilize dextrin, glucose, sucrose and xylose.
No growth is observed with acetate, lactate, lactose, maltose, raffinose, rhamnose or ribose.
Trace amounts of the respiratory isoprenoid quinone demethylmenaquinone DMK-9(H4) are present.
The most abundant fatty acids are C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0 and anteiso-C15 : 1.
The peptidoglycan type is A4β based on l-ornithine with a Ser–d-Asp or Ser–d-Glu interpeptide bridge.
The whole-cell sugars are glucose, xylose, rhamnose and ribose.
The DNA G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 66.2 mol%.
The type strain, SV45T (=LMG 24795T =DSM 19970T), was isolated from a permafrost soil sample collected in the Adventdalen valley, Spitsbergen, northern Norway.
